results.name: Table T(n,m) = 1 + n*m*(m+1)/2 read by antidiagonals: centered polygonal numbers.
comment: Row n gives the centered figurate numbers of the n-gon.
formula: T(n+1,m) = T(n,m) + m*(m+1)/2. - _Gary W. Adamson_ and _Michel Marcus_, Oct 13 2015
example: The upper left corner of the infinite array T is
mathematica: Table[T[n - m, m], {n, 0, 12}, {m, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 23 2020 *)
program: (Iverson's J language) Let cfn be the formula above. Then the first 20 rows and columns of T are: T =: cfn / ~ i. 20 where i.
(PARI) T(n,m) = 1 + n*m*(m+1)/2 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 28 2016
